summary: A player home with Riften style architecture.
descriptionHtml:
Location: The player home is located between Northwind Summit and Sarithi Farm
V1.1. 
- Added a well outside the home
- Added stable outside the home
- Added a path that branches off from the road between Northwind Summit and Sartithi Farm
- Fixed some interior issues and exterior issue\'s
- Fixed the main door \"was slighty off\"
- Added a screen shot of the location

*This update contains the new esp. Overwrite the old one when you drag it into your data folder.

Description:
**************
Azura\'s Rest is a player home suitable for all types of game play. It has a Riften style feel to the home with 2 floors. First floor is the living and alchemy area. Basement level is the blacksmith and enchanting area. There is a note outside the home player\'s should read explaining the story of the home. 

Note:  \"Working on some small fixes in the home and adding some new things outside the home\"
******
This is my very first mod. It started out just messing around with the creation kit and 1 week later this pop\'ed out of it. I tested the mod a couple of times. I do not see anything to be wrong with it. Everything in the home is Vanilla. I am assuming there might be issue\'s with it so i would greatly appreciate feedback on it. I did my best with the lighting in the home also. Oh yeah there is no navmesh in the home for NPC\'s to walking in the home. I have not found a decent guide for building one yet. Will do in the future if this mod is a success.


Features:
***********

- Map Marker for fast travel
- Comes complete with Anvil, Alchemy Table, Enchanting Table, and 1 Smelter
- Outdoor Wood Chopping Block with axe
- Cooking Pot in the kitchen
- Plenty of Storage Space
- 2 Mannequins
- 1 Weapon Rack
- 4 Weapon Plaques
- Awesome location with a view of Windhelm and Throat of The World.
Installation:
*************
- Extract .ESP to your Data folder. Make sure it is checked in your Skyrim Launcher.

Uninstall:
*******************
- Simply Delete \"Azura\'s Rest.ESP\" from your data folder
author: Xetric
